page.title: 08SOUTH MOOR MODERNAIRES
page.content: The band was formed 11 years ago and after many local successes came 2nd in the U.K. Championships in 1985 and qualified for the World Championships in August.There are about 45 members, mostly girls from 5-18,who attend practices twice a week on South Moor Park fields.Uniforms are provided, except for sandshoes.Most of the children have many medals for entering various competitions. Travel to events is by bus,sleeping or eating as we go,sometimes singing when we are nervous.On arrival we stand to attention,the drum-major blows her whistle and we're off.When everyone finishes their displays we wait for the results.The bands not mentioned are disappointed,but if our name is called we jump for joy.I play the kazoo,which sounds like a comb and tissue paper.
